before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ei9gi","text":"-Test the protocol before acquisition of your first sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"opii","text":"-Calibrate your instruments to ensure coherent measures","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39qib","text":"-Create an Ecotaxa account and request the right to create project way before ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbis4","text":"-Collect a plankton sample using a net","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"84l9j","text":"this protocol is for using planktoscope and collect usable result for quantitative imaging of plankton","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bh6c","text":"see also https://www.planktoscope.org/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":29}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"36CA3BAA26B011EC92F10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.planktoscope.org"}}}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"err16","text":"this protocols applies to the version 2.1 to 2.3 of the planktoscope and the 2.3 version of software. it is optimised to image 40µm-200µm organisms using the 25mm lens (as tube lens) and 16mm one as objective one and may be inaccurate with other configurations or light. Please note that the segmenter in currently also optimised for this and may need to be recoded (or adjusted) for other configurations, notably the size threshold but also the intensity threshold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ghiv","text":"Planktoscope is an optical instrument. As it optical elements (camera, lenses, flowcell) are highly sensible to dust and dirt. we recommend that you never touch any of those component with fingers and store the planktoscope in a dust free and humidity free area (or in a box when not used)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36o4n","text":"complete manual of assembly and software could be found at https://planktonscope.readthedocs.io/en/latest/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":47}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A8C31472330711ECBC110A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://planktonscope.readthedocs.io/en/latest"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5aq8r","text":"Check that your planktoscope is properly operating: on the optic configuration page:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"albun","text":"- turn the light on/off (you should see the light and the camera overview turning white)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nscs","text":"- check that adjusting the focus makes the focus motor turn","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gbql","text":"- check that the pump motor is functioning by pumping a little","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79b48","text":"- check that changing ISO/ white balance/ shutter speed leads to changes on the camera","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bbv1","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3D0A99606D7B11ECBCB00A58A9FEAC02","height":284,"id":214333,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9kio1","text":"optical configuration window","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Capture d’écran 2021-10-19 à 11.49.04.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gtj9bnpgp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gtj7bnpgp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gtj8bnpgp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gtj6bnpgp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4in79","text":"Pump calibration: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5jem","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ogsa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f4t83","text":"Peristaltic pump tubes flexibility varies with age, care and type of liquid used (e.g. lugol may age it quicker), calibrating the pump regularly could be needed but is not highly important to get good quantitative count since it is the number of images (therefore the volume imaged) which is important (not the pumped volume)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6u8q","text":"Clean tubing and flowcell from inside","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a579a","text":"imaging plankton will lead to have a lot of organic material and seawater in the fluidic system. Some may clog or accumulates in some parts of the fluidic system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q1a4","text":"Don't let it dry and try to get rid of it as soon as possible (if its occurs during sample acquisition, even abort this latter, take care of the clog, maybe dilute the sample    and restart acquisition while noting that the sample got diluted in the metadata   )","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":175,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":259,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r2be","text":"Pump tap or distilled water with high pumping rates  helps to unclog the system. make sure no plankton organisms remain in the fluidic system and especially on the internal walls of the flowcell. If it is the case don't hesitate to pinch (during 1-2 second) and release the tubing between the flowcell and the pump while pumping to create a sudden variation of pressure (e.g.   )","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":376,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dt0h0","text":"Over time, wet conditions and organic matter may create favorable condition for the growth of a bacterial film. The flowcell and tubing will look dirty from the inside. You can avoid this by pumping diluted bleach sometimes, let it act for 1-2 hours and carefully rinse the whole system   ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":287,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4l561","text":"Water, bacteria, and bleach together may favour the apparition of a calcium carbonate film inside the tubing and flowcell. It may either appear as dispersed cristals attached inside the flowcell or a white coating inside the tubing. To remove and clean this, pump some acidic solution (vinegar, citrus juice or other kind of other acids), let it rest for a few hours and rinse the system   ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":388,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5sscs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qunm","text":"Clean flowcell outside:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mbrr","text":"The flowcell is an optical critical component, keeping it clean is an absolute necessity. Don't touch it with fingers or other kind of dirty material. If dirty:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p9sa","text":"if only dry dusts are present, gently blow the flowcell (ideally with dry gas dispenser at a large distance - dry gas dispenser are also creating thermal chocs if used from too close, test it on other material before) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b5df","text":"if dirt in not only dry dusts it could be cleaned with optical paper and ethanol. DO NOT USE CLASSICAL WIPING PAPER which are usually enriched in silica fibers for solidity ... and may create scratches on the flowcell. (disposable nose tissue are better alternative if optical paper is not available)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eov42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8195","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"730lp","text":"Clean optical lenses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpm77","text":"as for the flowcell, optical lenses are critical elements of your planktoscope and should be kept as clean as possible. It starts by never touching them with fingers  (cleaning those would requires a lot of patience, efforts and may even lead to unexpected disappointments)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edoma","text":"dry dust: dry gas (with even more caution than previously","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"131sb","text":"others: only used optical paper","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v244","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev1sp","text":"clean the camera sensor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi1h6","text":"... critical part if any, NEVER touch it, only use dry gas","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rjtu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"239nt","text":"regularly calibrate the pump   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"34BBD21030B911EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"AD64DCD0286111ECBF69E3EC6C36DBD4","title":""}},"1":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6A835E4030B911EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"A30D92F0286011ECBF69E3EC6C36DBD4","title":""}},"2":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7EB77CC030B911EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"64D7B640286111ECBF69E3EC6C36DBD4","title":""}},"3":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F140037030B911EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"9CB08F7028D311ECBF0CF97AFACD213D","title":""}},"4":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C7F8C63030BB11EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"9CB08F7028D311ECBF0CF97AFACD213D","title":""}},"5":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BB3CFF7030BA11EC8D29A11989F3F2B8","id":0,"step_guid":"66BDBCC0278F11ECAA442909B6C534C8","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ld5c","text":"Do not hesitate to \"predict\" your project right away (even with a project/instrument that has nothing to do)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kq61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81jgp","text":"-How to do prediction (and help you to boost your validation ability) :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vn6n","text":"In the project (or \"Filtered\", in this case only the filtered vignettes would be used), select \"Train and Predict classifications\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fujal","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"17vet","text":"You can select any of the pre-existing project (including your own project) as a template for image recognition. By experience, using another project is only a first-aid, but won't replace prediction on images that you acquired with the same instrument/ same location / same plankton communities","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aam7","text":"Note that currently, only few \"sorted\" planktoscope projects exist (especially acquired with the same segmentation procedure than here), we therefore strongly encourage you after a first trial of prediction to quickly validate to re-predict on your own project.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36onr","text":"what could be used for first prediction : ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o2j2","text":"#4605 - Planktoscope NOAA WCOA21 rita-net (coastal US West coast from Vancouver to San Diego; Processed with current segmenter; Partly validated; Contains lots of artefacts due to lens mis-alignment see 5.1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":146,"length":52},{"style":"italic","offset":146,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqvq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"144ns","text":"#4356 - Planktoscope Tara Microbiomes P2/miniHSN : Lorient \u003e Punta Arenas V3 (Trans-atlantic transect from France to Ushuaia; Processed with other segmenter (works only with adding Deep Learning features into play); Fully validated)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":158,"length":55},{"style":"italic","offset":158,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeop7","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fou6n","text":"Push the  button \"select project below then click me. You then have the possibility to select what types of object to consider. It is recommended to try to avoid selecting too much objects to partly correct the usual strong imbalance between categories (here as an example limited to 100 example per group) (If you use project #4605 as an example, please remove artefacts)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75kif","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efu80","text":"click on \"continue to the classifier option screen \". Activate the pre-trained Deep Learning features (if not available see step 10). Inactivate variables that are not relevant for prediction and relate to position of the vignette in the initial images (bx, by, depth min/max, label, local centroid col/row, x, y)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k50k","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f2f8n","text":"Once done, images are now \"predicted\" (blue) but still wait for validation. Note that while classifying the different objects, the classifier also gives a classification \"score\" which determine if the label is attributed with high or low confidence. Using this score as a quick-filter is usually a good idea to be able to validate quickly well recognised images (and quickly start new predictions)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":171,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d45mu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e585p","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fq50k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75d7","text":"Doing repeated predictions on your own samples is better than doing some global one on random example project","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":109}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"335hh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kcgf","text":"Quickly validate objects to start to predict on your own plankton composition: the classifier is quite efficient and starts to give reasonable results starting from 30-50 images as example. Ecotaxa is then optimised to operate regular prediction rounds which could be heavily guided by the human (e.g. by doing prediction only on selections, stopping to predict some organisms etc). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b5tf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33i1k","text":"-once fully validated, export your results (lots of different solutions exist, the easiest to understand being the summary export with count per sample)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek1vj","text":"
